proposeNewAggregator(address).details: A zero address can be used to unset the proposed aggregator. Only owner can call.

proposeNewValidator(address).details: A zero address can be used to unset the proposed validator. Only owner can call.

upgradeAggregator().details: Must have a proposed aggregator. Only owner can call.

upgradeValidator().details: Must have a proposed validator. Only owner can call.

validate(uint256,int256,uint256,int256).details: Must be called by either the `s_currentAggregator.target`, or the `s_proposedAggregator`. If called by the `s_currentAggregator.target` this function passes the call on to the `s_currentValidator.target` and the `s_proposedValidator`, if it is set. If called by the `s_proposedAggregator` this function emits a `ProposedAggregatorValidateCall` to signal that the call was received.To guard against external `validate` calls reverting, we use raw calls here. We favour `call` over try-catch to ensure that failures are avoided even if the validator address is incorrectly set as a non-contract address.If the `aggregator` and `validator` are the same contract or collude, this could exhibit reentrancy behavior. However, since that contract would have to be explicitly written for reentrancy and that the `owner` would have to configure this contract to use that malicious contract, we refrain from using mutex or check here.This does not perform any checks on any roundId, so it is possible that a validator receive different reports for the same roundId at different points in time. Validator implementations should be aware of this.

acceptOwnership().notice: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

constructor.notice: Construct the ValidatorProxy with an aggregator and a validator

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address, pending.

typeAndVersion().notice: The type and version of this contract

upgradeAggregator().notice: Upgrade the aggregator by setting the current aggregator as the proposed aggregator.

upgradeValidator().notice: Upgrade the validator by setting the current validator as the proposed validator.

documentation.text: @notice Uses a single storage slot to store the current address
@notice The proposed aggregator called validate, but the call was not passed on to any validators

@notice Upgrade the aggregator by setting the current aggregator as the proposed aggregator.
 @dev Must have a proposed aggregator. Only owner can call.

@notice Upgrade the validator by setting the current validator as the proposed validator.
 @dev Must have a proposed validator. Only owner can call.

@notice The type and version of this contract
 @return Type and version string
